1.title: Stephanie Thorpe and Paula Rhodes Talk ElfQuest

episode of.title: To Be in the Biz (TV Series 2012– )

1.plot: TO BE IN THE BIZ interviews Producers/Actresses Stephanie Thorpe (The New Media Maven) and Paula Rhodes. We get the skinny on their ElfQuest fascination and their recent project on gaining the rights to produce an ElfQuest Series! Hear the inside scoop on how the ladies made their love of this series into something special!

2.title: Mark Benjamin

episode of.title: To Be in the Biz (TV Series 2012– )

2.plot: Mark Benjamin is a local actor in San Diego who had started in the industry as a successful theatre actor in Chicago and part of the "Second City" improv troupe. He left the industry to raise his family and pursued a more lucrative lifestyle that would support himself and his loved ones. Then fate dealt him a hand that would make him return to the life he missed the most... Acting.

3.title: Kevin Sizemore

episode of.title: To Be in the Biz (TV Series 2012– )

3.plot: Kevin Sizemore takes time out of his schedule to sit and talk with Kambra Potter from TME. He talks about his life and that one decision that made him decide that Acting was the career of choice for him and nothing else would suffice

4.title: Evette Vargas

episode of.title: To Be in the Biz (TV Series 2012– )

4.plot: TME's Ray Silveyra talks with Creator,Director and Producer Evette Vargas. She is the head of Digital Reign productions and created one of the hottest new shows since the inception of LOST and 24. She talks about Dark Prophet; a new action tv series that stars Chase Fine, Greer Bishop, Henry Rollins, and James Nardini.

5.title: David Lautman

episode of.title: To Be in the Biz (TV Series 2012– )

5.plot: David Lautman has been in the Entertainment world since birth. In this episode of To Be In The Biz, David talks with Crystal Hubbard from TME about his life and that one decision that made him decide that Acting was the career of choice for him and nothing else would suffice.

6.title: Steve Eastin

episode of.title: To Be in the Biz (TV Series 2012– )

6.plot: Steve Eastin is a veteran actor who is best known for powerful character roles. He has been in many films and TV shows including the popular Dexter and is also known as one of IMDB's top Underated Actors of All Time. Steve talks about his latest venture in the film, Watercolor Postcards with Bailee Madison,Conrad Goode and Laura Bell Bundy.

7.title: Conrad Goode

episode of.title: To Be in the Biz (TV Series 2012– )

7.plot: TME's Kambra Potter talks with Actor/Musician/Producer and Writer Conrad Goode about his career starting from graduating from the University of Missouri and playing college football to the gridiron stage of the NFL where he played for the New York Giants and Tampa Bay Buccaneers. He began his career in acting soon after that and then finally produced his first film called "Watercolor Postcards".

8.title: Chase Fein

episode of.title: To Be in the Biz (TV Series 2012– )

8.plot: Chase Fein, a graduate from NYU and successful working actor, talks about his journey in the entertainment business and how you need to make everyday count and surround yourself with positive people. He also talks about the new hit transmedia series he is involved in called Dark Prophet, where he plays Dai Shepherd; a genius composer and mathematician who discovers secret messages embedded within music.

imdb.title: To Be in the Biz
akas: To Be in the Biz (United States)
plot: An insider's look into Hollywood's unsung heros; the crew, the producers, actors, personal trainers, publicists, and the people who make the world of movie and television magic possible.::TME PR AQ
